item.title: Residential and Small Business VoIP Rates Crushed
item.description: In recent years, VoIP telephony, also known as broadband phone service, has transformed from a niche computer application into a major competitor to traditional telephone services. This shift is largely due to the widespread adoption of broadband internet and its increased availability to small businesses. As a result of increased broadband access, there’s been a surge in VoIP providers, with Phone Power emerging as a major player. Phone Power is disrupting the industry by offering unlimited residential and small home-based business service plans for less than $15 per month.
